item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "I just saved your fucking life, Mom. . . . You could at least offer me an Oreo." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "I write this sitting in the kitchen sink." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Agatha Christi
item.description: "I like living. I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow; but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing." -- Agatha Christi

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "Never do anything yourself that others can do for you." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "A good novel tells us the truth about its hero; but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are no uninteresting things, only uninterested people." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and a tired man who wants a book to read." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "You have not wasted your time; you have helped to save the world. We are not buffoons, but very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "It takes a very long time to become young." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by John D. MacDonald
item.description: "We were about to give up and call it a night when somebody threw the girl off the bridge." -- John D. MacDonald

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Betty MacDonald
item.description: "Another female household-hinter gave me a recipe for a big hearty main dish of elbow macaroni, mint jelly, lima beans, mayonnaise and cheese baked until 'hot and yummy.' Unless my taste buds are paralyzed, this dish could be baked until hell freezes over and it might get hot but never 'yummy." -- Betty MacDonald

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Vladmir Nabakov
item.description: "My loathings are simple. stupidity, oppression, crime, cruelty, soft music. My pleasures are the most intense known to man: writing and butterfly hunting." -- Vladmir Nabakov

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "She was good at talking with young people. She seemed to view them as interesting foreigners." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "It wasn't until I started reading and found books they wouldn't let us read in school that I discovered you could be insane and happy and have a good life without being like everybody else." -- John Waters

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Nathanael West
item.description: "Betty took him for a walk in the zoo and he was amused by her evident belief in the curative power of animals. She seemed to think that it must steady him to look at a buffalo." -- Nathanael West

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Bryan Lee O'Malley
item.description: "Scott, if your life had a face, I would punch it. I would punch your life in the face." -- Bryan Lee O'Malley

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Bryan Lee O'Malley
item.description: "this song is for the guy who keeps yelling from the balcony, and it's called 'we hate you, please die." -- Bryan Lee O'Malley

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "The house smelled musty and damp, and a little sweet, as if it were haunted by the ghosts of long-dead cookies." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "His name is Marcus: he is four and a half and possesses that deep gravity and seriousness that only small children and mountain gorillas have ever been able to master." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Daisy looked up at him with the kind of expression that Jesus might have given someone who had just explained that he was probably allergic to bread and fishes, so could He possibly do him a quick chicken salad..." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description:
"He was having more fun than a barrelful of monkeys.*
*Several years earlier Spider had actually been tremendously disappointed by a barrelful of monkeys. It had done nothing he had considered particularly entertaining, apart from emit interesting noises, and eventually, once the noises had stopped and the monkeys were no longer doing anything at all—except possibly on an organic level—had needed to be disposed of in the dead of night." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Kirsti add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.
